intro: Hieracium scouleri var. griseum, commonly known as the gray hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is known for its hairy, grayish-green foliage. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators. It is a relatively small plant, usually reaching heights of less than 30 centimeters.
